title: Heavyweight boxing legend George Foreman dies aged 76, says family
byline: Boxing heavyweight legend George Foreman has died aged 76, according to his family.

title: Two killed in shooting in Matara
byline: Two individuals were killed in a shooting incident last night on Sinhasana Road, near the southern entrance of the Devundara Sri Vishnu Devalaya in Matara.

title: Complications in female, youth representation leads to most rejected nomination lists at LG polls: EC
byline: Complications in fulfilling the requirements to include stipulated percentages of female and youth representation in lists, as well as lack of supporting documents of the contestants have led to a significant number of nominations lists from every political party getting rejected this time, the Election Commission said.

title: SJB nominates Dr. Ruvaiz Haniffa for Colombo Mayor
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has officially nominated Dr. Ruvaiz Haniffa as its candidate for mayor of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC).

title: School uniform material distribution for this year completed: Ministry
byline: The distribution of school uniform materials have been carried out this year for 10,096 government schools together with 822 government approved Pirivens, the Education Ministry said.

title: Heavyweight boxing legend George Foreman dies aged 76
byline: Boxing heavyweight legend George Foreman has died aged 76.

title: 35 injured in head-on collision of buses in Warakapola
byline: At least 35 people were injured when two Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) buses collided head-on in the Dummaladeniya area of Warakapola, along the Colombo-Kandy road.

title: U.S. Coast Guard to deliver another coast guard cutter to SL Navy
byline: The U.S. will tranfer another coast guard cutter to Sri Lanka in 2026, according to a statement from its embassy here on Saturday.

title: Three arrested for bribery attempt at Colomboâ€™s luxury hotel
byline: The Bribery Commission arrested three individuals, including a businessman and an NGO coordinator, for attempting to extort a bribe of Rs. 500,000 in exchange for a traditional medical certificate from the Ayurveda Medical Council.
